meanings.definition: The act of flowing back or flowing again.
meanings.sent1: After the heavy rain, the reflowing of the river was noticeable.
meanings.sent2: The reflowing of the lava created new patterns on the rock surface.
meanings.sent3: The reflowing of the chocolate fountain made everyone crave sweets.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like a reflowing river, constantly changing and unpredictable.
meanings.sent5: The reflowing of memories brought back the warmth of childhood summers.

meanings.definition: The process of melting and then cooling a material to create a smooth surface.
meanings.sent1: The reflowing of the metal resulted in a shiny finish.
meanings.sent2: Artisans use reflowing to achieve a flawless glass texture.
meanings.sent3: The reflowing of the ice cream made it extra creamy and delicious.
meanings.sent4: The reflowing of the wax formed a seamless seal.
meanings.sent5: The reflowing of the plastic gave it a polished look.

meanings.definition: The act of moving or changing direction.
meanings.sent1: The reflowing of traffic caused delays on the highway.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, the reflowing of the wind changed its course.
meanings.sent3: The reflowing of the dance routine surprised the audience.
meanings.sent4: His speech had a reflowing of emotions, shifting from joy to sadness.
meanings.sent5: The reflowing of ideas in the meeting led to a creative breakthrough.
